channel.title: Reuters: World News
channel.description: Reuters.com is your source for breaking news, business, financial and investing news, including personal finance and stocks. Reuters is the leading global provider of news, financial information and technology solutions to the world's media, financial institutions, businesses and individuals.
channel.copyright: All rights reserved. Users may download and print extracts of content from this website for their own personal and non-commercial use only. item.title: Boston Globe denounces Trump candidacy in 'front page' satire
item.description: (Reuters) - Headlines screaming "Deportations to begin" and "Markets sink as trade war looms" top a parody newspaper front page the Boston Globe posted on Saturday, with a scathing editorial denouncing Republican presidential frontrunner Donald Trump's candidacy.

item.title: Sanders wins Wyoming, prepares to take on Clinton in New York
item.description: WASHINGTON - Bernie Sanders won the U.S. presidential Democratic nominating contest in Wyoming on Saturday, besting rival Hillary Clinton and adding to a string of recent victories as the two candidates gear up for a crucial matchup in New York.

item.title: German politicians urge UK's Cameron to do more in fight against tax evasion
item.description: BERLIN (Reuters) - German politicians have called on British Prime Minister David Cameron to do more in tackling the use of offshore companies set up in British overseas territories to evade taxes.

item.title: Kerala temple fire kills over 60, more than 200 injured - TV
item.description: NEW DELHI (Reuters) - A huge fire swept through a temple in southern India early on Sunday, killing more than 60 people and injuring 200 gathered for a fireworks display to mark the start of the Hindu new year.

item.title: At least 60 feared dead in Kerala temple fire - TV
item.description: NEW DELHI (Reuters) - A huge fire swept through a temple in southern India early on Sunday, killing more than 60 people and injuring 200 gathered for a fireworks display to mark the start of the Hindu new year.

item.title: Philippine troops clash with Muslim rebels; 23 killed, 73 hurt
item.description: MANILA (Reuters) - Philippine soldiers battled a group of about 120 Muslim rebels linked to Islamic State in a ten-hour assault on a southern island that killed 23 people, an army spokesman said on Sunday.

item.title: German spy chief says Islamic State wants to attack but no firm plan known
item.description: BERLIN (Reuters) - Islamic State wants to carry out attacks in Germany and the security situation is "very serious", the head of the country's domestic intelligence agency (BfV) told a Sunday newspaper, adding that he knew of no concrete plot to strike.

item.title: China investigates former official of Sichuan province over graft
item.description: BEIJING (Reuters) - A former vice governor of China's populous southwestern province of Sichuan has been put under investigation for suspected corruption, the ruling Communist Party's graft-busting body said late on Saturday.

item.title: UK PM Cameron releases tax records after 'Panama Papers' storm
item.description: LONDON (Reuters) - British Prime Minister David Cameron published his tax records on Sunday in an attempt to draw a line under questions about his personal finances raised by the mention of his late father in the Panama Papers for setting up an offshore fund.

item.title: Rebels and Syrian government forces battle in fierce clashes near Aleppo - monitor
item.description: BEIRUT (Reuters) - Syrian government forces and their allies battled insurgents including al Qaeda fighters in fierce clashes south of Aleppo late on Saturday, and the rebels advanced taking over two hilltops, the Syrian Observatory for Human Rights said.

item.title: Bus crash in Peru kills at least 23
item.description: LIMA (Reuters) - At least 23 people were killed and more than 30 injured in Peru when a bus in which they were traveling plunged over a ravine into a river below, authorities said on Saturday.

item.title: Germany's Schaeuble says offshore companies must be transparent
item.description: BERLIN (Reuters) - German Finance Minister Wolfgang Schaeuble has called for offshore companies to become transparent after a huge leak of documents from Panama showed how they are used to stash the wealth of the world's rich and powerful.

item.title: Last main Brussels and Paris suspects held, threat remains
item.description: BRUSSELS (Reuters) - The main identified suspects in Islamic State attacks on Paris and Brussels are now dead or in custody after Belgian investigators charged two men on Saturday with aiding last month's Brussels suicide bombers.

item.title: Argentina's Fernandez faces money laundering probe -source
item.description: BUENOS AIRES (Reuters) - Cristina Fernandez, who stepped down as president of Argentina in December after eight years in office, has been officially accused by a prosecutor of money laundering, a court source said on Saturday.

item.title: Egypt says Italy spat centres on refusal to share phone records in Regeni probe
item.description: CAIRO (Reuters) - Tension between Egypt and Italy stems from Cairo's refusal to hand over extensive phone records as part of an investigation into the killing of Italian researcher Giulio Regeni, a senior Egyptian prosecutor said on Saturday.

item.title: French labour reform protests turn violent
item.description: PARIS (Reuters) - Demonstrations around France against a draft labour reform law turned violent on Saturday, with at least seven police officers injured and 17 people arrested in Paris and Rennes, which saw the worst clashes.

item.title: Kerry aims to ease crisis over Afghan unity pact during Kabul visit
item.description: KABUL (Reuters) - U.S. Secretary of State John Kerry suggested that Afghanistan's national unity government could continue beyond September, a step that could irk the opposition even as he attempts to avert a brewing political crisis.

item.title: Britain's Cameron says he mishandled Panama Papers tax scrutiny
item.description: LONDON (Reuters) - British Prime Minister David Cameron said on Saturday he should have handled scrutiny of his family's tax arrangements better, seeking to reassert his leadership after days of negative media coverage and calls for his resignation.

item.title: Explosions hit Afghan capital Kabul after Kerry visit
item.description: KABUL (Reuters) - At least two explosions hit the diplomatic zone of Kabul on Saturday, shortly after visiting U.S. Secretary of State John Kerry left following meetings with Afghan officials including President Ashraf Ghani.

item.title: Paris suspect admits to being Brussels airport "man in hat" - prosecutors
item.description: BRUSSELS (Reuters) - Belgium's federal prosecutor said on Saturday that Paris attacks suspect Mohamed Abrini admitted to being the "man in the hat" seen accompanying two suicide bombers at Brussels airport on March 22.
